page.title: 09MORRIS DANCING IN NETHERLEY
page.content: { Morris dancing}was started by{men many years ago in{England}but recently {young females}have made the tradition more popular.They join{troupes}of about twelve dancers with a leader at the front.Some of the steps involve marching in lines. { Girls}can join troupes from aged three onwards.Each troupe has a name. There are several competitions where troupes compete for{trophies}and {medals.}Girls wear a short black waistcoat over their dresses on which to show of there medals. One such troupe called{The Stars meet in the Netherley district of Liverpool at the local Comprehensive. One member writes,{"You have to work {very hard to get in to the troupe. I {have won three trophies and forty {medals. I like morris dancing because {it keeps you fit ".
